result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myles TJ Gudgalis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis not in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Myles TJ Gudgalis.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt heard and has located defendant. Defendant is currently at Trempealeau County Health Care Center and will be there for another 60 to 90 days. State heard and asks that the bond forfeiture action be dismissed. Court heard and dismisses the bond forfeiture action.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Hearing

Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis not in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video for Myles TJ Gudgalis.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes warrant due to defendant's nonappearance.

Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Myles TJ Gudgalis. New charges are pending with Branch I. State requests warrant. Attorney Bartelt heard on mental health issues of defendant. Court continues status with Branch I. If no appearance, warrant will be authorized.

Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Myles TJ Gudgalis. Defendant has not been in contact with counsel since release from custody. Attorney Zaleski requests to withdraw as counsel. Defendant heard and wants to resolve case. Attorney Zaleski gave assessment of case and feels defendant would benefit from a second opinion. Court permits Attorney Zaleski to withdraw. Court orders defendant to go to SPD to request new counsel and return. Defendant returns. New counsel cannot be appointed until Attorney Zaleski is removed from record. Court sets status.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Myles TJ Gudgalis. State would like to stay hearing and current cash bond is keeping defendant in jail. Court has a $500 cash bond was set in March and bond was raised in mid April to $1500 cash. Attorney Zaleski heard and does not want his bond to be forfeited. Attorney Zaleski requests a lowered bond. Court denies request for a lowered bond.

and arraignment. Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis appeared by video, from Grant County Jail .  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski appeared by phone. Defendant refused to out of bed and participate in video court. Attorney Zaleski heard on how to proceed and would like to proceed today as long as defendant can hear. Correctional Officer verified that the audio from the Court can be heard. State asks for $500 cash bond remain. Attorney Zaleski asks for a signature bond. Court orders $1500 cash bond concurrent with 22CM34. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant for defendant's nonappearance. Court authorizes warrant.

Defendant Myles TJ Gudgalis appeared by video, in custody from the Grant County Jail,  Attorney Lisa Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant remains on his cot laying down but listening. Court reviews charges, penalties, and right to counsel. State requests $200 cash bond and to submit to drug testing by court or law enforcement. Defendant heard. Defendant referred to SPD. Court orders $500 cash bond and must submit to drug testing upon request of the court or law enforcement. Arraignment date set.
Defendant shall submit to drug testing upon request of the courts or law enforcement.
